reviews.text: We exchanged our time share condo with Interval International and was contacted only 2 weeks before our trip that we had a unit that was available. The reviews at the time were good so we accepted. In the 2 weeks before we left there were some reviews that frankly scared us and we were very concerned. I did call management at Williamsburg Plantation and was assured that any problems that they had they would rectify but they did not expect any. We travelled to Williamsburg a little nervous but we were pleasantly surprised. Our unit (205B) was spotless with everything we needed present. The staff was very attentive. All week I looked for reasons to find problems but we were all very pleased and had a great trip and would visit Williamsburg Plantation in a heartbeat!!
reviews.title: Great place to stay!!

likes.liked: — The space and cleanliness that the unit provided

reviews.text: My husband and I have traveled to Virginia almost every year since we met. Now, 23 years later, it is an annual trip we take with our children. Once we found Williamsburg Plantation, I stopped booking other hotels with the exception of one year....and the next year we were back! It is clean and the two bedroom units are very roomy and comfortable. After a tiresome day of touring and theme park visits, it has become our refuge to refuel for the following day. Definitely a much superior option to a hotel room when traveling as a family. We have never used any of the nice ammenities other than the pool or participate in the scheduled activities...just too many wonderful things to do in the area! I would highly recommend this location to traveling families and my family will certainly return in the future!
reviews.title: Many Happy Returns

reviews.text: We did an exchange with our timeshare through interval and it was only two weeks prior to our stay. We have never been to Williamsburg before and thought it would be a good family vaca. The resort was very nice, the outside looked like apartments and was fully equipted with everything, kitchen and laundry facility right inside. We never went out for breakfast and stayed in one night and used the BBQ pits right outside the rooms. We went grocery shopping for food and drinks right down the road. There was a trash recepticle close by. The rooms were very clean and had everything we needed in them. The outside pool was always busy but that was expected and there was a kiddie pool for our toddler, we never went to the indoor one. It was close to all the attractions and all the restaurants and the staff was very helpful. they also had wonderful activities for the whole family. We went to Colonial Williamsburg, and did not pay for the day pass, thought it was too much. Went to Virginia Beach for a day which was fun for everyone. Overall nice family vaca!!!!!
reviews.title: Very nice place!!!

reviews.text: Just got back from a one week stay in Williamsburg. We have stayed in the area before and are Marriott time share owners. This resort is no where near the same quality as a Marriott. The resort's appearance overall was just average, no sprinkler system, weeds on the property etc. The room was clean, but was in much need of a renovation. The couches were ripped, carpets slightly stained. There was an odd stagnant smell when your first came into the hallway of the unit, probably from other people cooking in other units. The air condition unit worked well, but was so loud it was difficult to fall asleep at night. In a one bedroom unit, you only get a queen sized bed which gave me a terrible back ache, the mattress was so old. We only were given one tiny shampoo in the bathroom and when we requested more, we never got them. Luckily, we left and stayed in Virginia Beach for a few days at the Marriott Spring Hill Suites which were fine. When we returned to the unit following our Va. Beach stay the following morning, we woke up to find no water was working in the entire unit. We never received a phone call informing us that the water was being serviced and had to wait for about an hour and a half for the water to be turned back on, which delayed our entire plans for the day. Then, the following morning, we woke up to find police officers filing reports on several cars that had been keyed the night before. Could this have anything to do w/ the fact that there was no one working at the security gate the entire week? Luckily our brand new truck wasn't one of the ones vandalized and we were out of there the next day. I would recommend staying at the Marriott Ford's Colony resort, much better quality overall. Can't comment on the ammenities, pool, etc. b/c we tried our best to stay off the resort as much as possible. We do enjoy Williamsburg, lots to offer and the kids loved Busch Gardens and Water Country, just don't stay here!
reviews.title: Wouldn't go back.......

reviews.text: My family and I just returned from the Williamsburg Plantation and I can tell you that there is no way that we would ever stay there again. We went there on a timeshare exchange through Interval Intl. Definitely not 5 star but our first impression of the resort was that it was very nice. Check in was a breeze and we were given a nice, clean and what appeared to be a newer 2- bedroom unit.
reviews.title: Roaches
Some Pros, Some Cons...
reviews.text: We recently traveled to Williamsburg Plantation this past week. There are just a few pros and cons to be aware of before you go...PROS-nice resort overall, we had a nice two-bedroom unit, air conditioning worked well, beds and furniture were nice, most utensils, small appliances were almost new, nice little porch on the back, comfortable bedding, spacious bathroom, very clean, complimentary coffee, brand new TVs and DVD player. CONS- murky pool, extremely crowded, no wi-fi in units, no restaurant or general store on -site, no oven ("B" units only have a hotplate), no grill (we had o buy one at Wal-Mart), only a few dishwasher pellets, trash bags, thin ceilings, crowded workout room (one piece of equipment was out of order all week), if you need darkness to sleep, bring dark-colored sheets to cover the windows, there re huge flourescent lights which makes it seems like daylight all night long. All in all we had a nice stay, but there are definitely some cons. My best piece of advice is to do your research BEFORE you go and be prepared.

reviews.title: Not 5 Star but a good family place
reviews.text: My family and I exchanged 3 Marriott timeshares for this place (it was all that II had available). I agree with the other reviewers who state that it is not a 5-star Marriott equivalent but it is still nice and should be fine for most people.

reviews.title: Nice Vacation
reviews.text: We had difficulty getting 3 rooms together until the day we arrived and they called to say that we are in a row, all on the top level. Check-in went smooth and the staff was nice. We had a few invitations for “free lunch” but ignored them knowing that they were sales pitches.

reviews.title: Good place to stay!!!
reviews.text: The suites are huge but the layout is strange. We had older units but they were clean (though dusty) and the furniture was in good condition. Both bedrooms had queen beds. One of the bathrooms was standard and the other had a huge Jacuzzi and sauna; though there was no vanity. The master bedroom did not have a TV but had a boom box. One of the rooms could have been laid out better to have another bed. The beds were comfortable enough but the blankets and bedspreads were out of Motel 6. Those blinds were painful when the sun came in at 6:00 am. We did not see any bugs anywhere in the units.

reviews.title: Average
reviews.text: The kitchenette was tiny though well stocked. We had no dishwasher, but they left us plenty of soap tablets as if we had one. The sink was way too small to wash dishes in and the cabinets were so high that we could not reach beyond the first shelf. We did manage to have some decent meals between the grills, hot plate and griddle.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: While we were pleased with our unit for our weeks stay, I would have to agree with other travelers and say this is certainly not a five star resort. I would caution you on taking the sales presentation during your stay as it will take more than four hours of your vacation away and they are asking way to much for their units. There current sales pitch is to have you trade in your existing timeshare unit and upgrade to their location. What they fail to tell you is that you actually don't get anything for your unit. It just looks good on paper. I talked to several other people about offers they received and they were all lower than mine with a trade. The other offers were without trades. I contacted the sales person via e-mail about the inconsistency with offers and I have heard nothing back as of this date. The asking price for a four bedroom condo is around $30,000.00 for one week of timeshare. You can take a lot of vacations for $30,000.00. Again buyer beware and have a great vacation where ever you go.
reviews.title: Buyer Beware

likes.disliked: — Lack of services during our stay

reviews.text: We loved our unit!!! It was clean, beautiful, spacious and close to the clubhouse. Although we did not have an oven (who wants to cook on vacation anyway), we had a full size refrigerator, dishwasher, and a large two burner hot plate, coffee maker and electric skillet in the kitchen. The floor plan was open with a large corner T.V. that could be viewed from the living or dining room. The main bathroom was HUGE with a jacuzzi, and the beds very comfortable. We could not have asked for a better unit. Our VCR would not work at 9:45 one night, I called to the clubhouse and within 10 minutes, maintenance was at our door with a replacement. The freezer froze up in our refrigerator one day, and within 5 minutes they were again in our unit to fix the problem.
reviews.title: A Wonderful Place to Stay

likes.disliked: — WiFi only available at the clubhouse

reviews.title: Don't even think about it!!!
reviews.text: We used the outdoor pool twice and the water was clean and clear with a great walkway going into the water which was great for both the young and the old. There was a lot of open well kept grass area between the buildings with a little tot playground which our 16 month old grandson loved.

reviews.title: Simplemente perfecto!!
reviews.text: I was very concerned when I read some of the reviews on the website about Williamsburg Plantation and honestly, can't believe they were talking about the same place. Believe me, I am very picky about where I stay and would highly recommend this place.

reviews.title: Would never go back!
reviews.text: The location was very convenient to Williamsburg, the outlet mall, and there was lots of dining all around us.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed in Unit 39B, which is an upstairs unit, from 10/4 - 10/11. The unit was spacious and nicely decorated. It was a two-bedroom, two-bath unit with tubs in both bathrooms, one a jacuzzi. There was a comfortable living room with fireplace and big screen TV and DVR. Each bedroom had a TV as well. It was very quiet.
reviews.title: We Were Very Happy with this Resort

reviews.text: There were only two of us and there were far more towels than we needed, so we did fine without mid-week housekeeping. The kitchen was adequately furnished for our purposes.
reviews.title: Enjoyable and Comfortable...Bring your paperwork

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We didn't use the pools, tennis courts, basketball or volleyball, but they were there. There are picnic tables and barbecues but I think they could use a few more barbecues. They also have a nature trail.
reviews.title: great stay

likes.liked: — the size of the rooms was excellent
likes.disliked: — not a lot of natural light

reviews.text: I didn't want to bring my laptop, so we had to rely on their computers. There are only three and they are often all in use, but the time limit of 15 minutes made that bearable. I don't know what it would be like during peak season, however.
reviews.title: Excellent Resort located in a Beautiful City

likes.disliked: — Like it so much we visit often.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: It was easy to get around Williamsburg and the resort is close to the outlet malls and more restaurants than you could ever visit.
reviews.title: Southern Charm

likes.disliked: — Bad water pressure in one of the showers (that is honestly the only thing I can think of)
